intro: Ruschia bolusiae, commonly known as the Bolus's Ruschia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly known as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent leaves and vibrant flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange, often blooming in spring. Ruschia bolusiae is popular in rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
